Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2008 05:43PM Odalys wrote: Here is an update being passed around from John. Sorry, it's a few days old (Nov 5). .  I'm hoping if someone else has a newer update they can post it here.    ______________________________________________________________________________________ Thanks! I truly believe that the prayers & well wishes do work. Deb is doing a little better. We are spending quality time together. So it isn't all bad. She is tough. She is starting to have opinions on things, like IF we are going for another walk and where to. Normally, I would lose these arguments. Now she is just protesting. A very good sign! She also is eating well, laughs at me & gives kisses. She now knows my name and can identify our girls by their pictures (they are out of town). She is now using sentences again. So she is making improvement. We are all going to get through this stuff. We just have to keep the faith. Thanks for your support. John

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2009 09:24AM Odalys wrote: This is her last post to us.  Her spirit always shining through..... Posted in: Connecting With Others Who Have a Similar Diagnosis + Recurrence and Metastatic Disease, Created: Oct 23, 2008 02:15 am Alaska Deb Update Hi all- My side effects are very slowly getting better. I still communicate for shit....I will be talking along and the next word I want to say is just gone....a hole in the middle of my brain instead of a recipe I've made a hundred times. I have kept some little notes by my chair saying what I couldn't do at all last week that is easy enough to do this week, even though it is still full of mistakes. Tiny baby steps are really hard to measure when you see every stinking step of the progress. I was glad to see everyones notes. I was going to say something in person, but I am just too damn tired to do it tonight. I don't have to be anywhere in the morning, so maybe in the morning I will get a chance to come here and finish up.... Bugs and Fishes Deb

Does anyone know what I can do to reduce the swelling? Any suggestions are appreciated.
Posts.Title: injured arm and fractured fingers Odalys Binney4

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2007 09:08PM Odalys wrote: Hi Shenry, The clip they put in at time of the biopsy is something they always do to mark the site that has been biopsied.  They do the same whenever they perform surgery on any internal organ.  This is standard surgical practice that has been going on since the 1950's or so.  The wire localization they do before the lumpectomy is to mark the site for the surgeon.  Think of it like turning on the lights on the road.  It helps the surgeon locate the site. I hope this helps.  Best of luck on your lumpectomy.  Hope all goes well.
Posts.Title: lumpectomy question shenry Miko

Posts.Content: Odalys wrote: Has anyone fractured a finger on the arm that has no lymph glands? I did on 12/29/06. While walking my dog, I tripped and landed on the side walk, face first! Ouch...I received road burns on the left cheek, left shoulder, left hand, and fractured two fingers (pinky and ring). I also needed three stitches on my left upper lip. I am concerned of developing LE on my left hand. So far only the fingers are swollen and stiff and the Orthopedic doctor told me not to worry because trauma does not cause lymphedema. I am not too sure about that. My fingers are very swollen and it has been three weeks. Any thoughts? Log in to post a reply
